subject: Economics
title: The Replication Crisis: When Economic Studies Fail
description: One-minute skill: The Replication Crisis: When Economic Studies Fail.

hook.text: A team tried to replicate 18 famous economics experiments. Only 11 produced the same results.

buildup.text: Economics relies on studies to guide policy.

discovery.text: Publication bias is a culprit: journals publish surprising results and reject boring confirmations.

twist.text: Some debunked results still appear in textbooks. Ideas that entered policy decades ago were never checked again.

climax.text: The crisis is forcing economics to adopt pre-registration, open data, and replication studies.

punchline.text: Good science doubts itself. Great science proves itself wrong.

quiz.question: What did replication studies reveal about economics research?
options: About a third of famous results couldn't be reproduced
